intro: Sideroxylon quadriloculare, commonly known as the four-chambered ironwood, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Sideroxylon quadriloculare is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
